name: Congestive Heart Failure
description: A chronic cardiac condition affecting primarily older adults with significant mortality risk if untreated or managed informally. Requires substantial hospital-level care.
ai_interventions_impact: Hospital Decision Support AI improves hospital resolution rates by 10% and reduces mortality by 15%.

name: Tuberculosis
description: A serious infectious disease with very slow resolution requiring 25+ weeks of treatment. Has low but persistent mortality and high disability impact.
ai_interventions_impact: CHW Decision Support AI is especially effective for improving treatment adherence at community level.

name: Pneumonia
description: A respiratory infection with very high incidence in children under five. Good resolution rates with appropriate antibiotics but significant mortality if untreated.
ai_interventions_impact: Diagnostic AI significantly improves resolution rates at primary care level.

name: Malaria
description: A parasitic disease with moderate-high incidence in endemic areas. Good response to appropriate treatment at CHW/primary levels.
ai_interventions_impact: CHW Decision Support AI enables more effective community-level treatment.

name: Fever of Unknown Origin
description: A symptomatic presentation with diverse underlying causes affecting all ages. Features moderate spontaneous resolution and good response to healthcare interventions.
ai_interventions_impact: Diagnostic AI helps identify underlying causes faster at primary care level.

name: Diarrheal Disease
description: An acute gastrointestinal condition with very high incidence especially in children. Excellent response to ORS/Zinc and can be effectively managed at community level.
ai_interventions_impact: Self-Care Apps improve home management outcomes and reduce need for formal care.

name: Infant Pneumonia
description: A more severe form of pneumonia in infants under 1 year. Features lower spontaneous resolution and requires more intensive management.
ai_interventions_impact: Hospital Decision Support AI significantly improves infant mortality rates.

name: HIV Management (Chronic)
description: Focuses on stable HIV patients on antiretroviral therapy. Very low "resolution" rates without formal care but good stabilization with appropriate ART.
ai_interventions_impact: Self-Care Apps significantly improve treatment adherence and outcomes.

name: Upper Respiratory Tract Infection
description: Common viral respiratory infection with excellent spontaneous resolution and minimal additional benefit from healthcare intervention.
ai_interventions_impact: Self-Care Apps effectively manage symptoms and reduce unnecessary facility visits.

name: Moderate Urban System
description: A middle-tier healthcare system in urban settings with reasonable infrastructure. Represents typical urban healthcare in middle-income countries.
system_description: Features 65% initial formal care seeking and 25% transition from informal to formal care. Has standard mortality rates across all levels of care, with balanced referral patterns. Per diem costs range from $7 (informal) to $350 (tertiary).
ai_interventions_impact: AI interventions have standard effectiveness in this balanced system.

name: Weak Rural System
description: Limited healthcare capacity in rural areas with poor access. Significant challenges in healthcare delivery and outcomes.
system_description: Only 30% of patients initially seek formal care, and just 10% transition from informal to formal care later. Features 40% higher untreated rates, significantly reduced resolution rates (40-50% below standard), and 50-100% higher mortality rates.
ai_interventions_impact: AI interventions can be transformative but face implementation challenges due to infrastructure limitations.

name: Strong Urban System LMIC
description: An aspirational high-quality system in lower/middle-income urban areas. Represents best-in-class urban healthcare in developing countries.
system_description: High initial formal care seeking (80%) and good transition from informal care (35%). Features 20-30% better resolution rates and 20-40% lower mortality compared to baseline. Has efficient referral pathways and higher quality infrastructure.
ai_interventions_impact: AI interventions can be highly effective and well-integrated into existing digital systems.

name: Fragile Conflict System
description: Severely compromised healthcare in humanitarian crisis or conflict zones. Extremely challenging healthcare delivery environment.
system_description: Extremely limited access (only 20% seek formal care) with 60% remaining completely untreated. Resolution effectiveness is reduced by 40-70% with mortality 50-150% higher than normal. Referral pathways are broken (60-80% reduced).
ai_interventions_impact: AI interventions face significant implementation barriers but can provide critical decision support where healthcare workers are overwhelmed.

name: High Income System
description: World-class healthcare in wealthy nations with nearly universal access. Represents healthcare systems in developed countries.
system_description: Features 90% formal care seeking and 70% transition from informal to formal care. Has 50-70% better resolution rates and 50-70% lower mortality compared to standard. Very efficient referral patterns but substantially higher costs ($15-1200 per day).
ai_interventions_impact: AI interventions can be seamlessly integrated but may show less dramatic improvements due to already high baseline performance.

name: Maternal and Child Health
description: Focuses on improving outcomes for pregnant women and children under 5.
system_description: Encompasses infant pneumonia and childhood diarrhea. Often requires strong referral systems to manage complications.
ai_interventions_impact: Triage AI and CHW Decision Support are particularly valuable for identifying complications early. Diagnostic AI has demonstrated 15-20% improvement in pediatric diagnosis accuracy.

name: Infectious Disease Control
description: Addresses high-burden infectious diseases in low-resource settings.
system_description: Includes tuberculosis, malaria, pneumonia, and fever management. Focuses on early detection, appropriate treatment, and adherence to long-term protocols.
ai_interventions_impact: CHW Decision Support has shown 25% improvement in protocol adherence. Diagnostic AI can reduce time to diagnosis by 30-50% for complex infectious cases.

name: Chronic Disease Management
description: Manages long-term conditions requiring continuous care and monitoring.
system_description: Includes HIV management, congestive heart failure, and other non-communicable diseases. Emphasizes adherence, complication monitoring, and managing across care levels.
ai_interventions_impact: Self-Care Apps demonstrate 30% improvement in medication adherence. Hospital Decision Support AI shows 20% reduction in readmission rates for chronic conditions.

name: Primary Health Care
description: Strengthens front-line healthcare delivery for common conditions.
system_description: Covers high-volume conditions like URTI, diarrhea, and uncomplicated fever. Focuses on appropriate management at lower levels of care to prevent overburdening hospitals.
ai_interventions_impact: Triage AI reduces unnecessary visits by up to 25%. Diagnostic AI improves appropriate referral decisions by 15-30% at primary care level.

name: Emergency Medical Services
description: Improves outcomes for acute and emergency conditions.
system_description: Addresses severe complications across diseases including severe malaria, acute cardiac events, and obstetric emergencies. Emphasizes rapid triage, stabilization, and appropriate level of care.
ai_interventions_impact: Triage AI can reduce critical delays by 40-60%. Hospital Decision Support and Bed Management AI together improve emergency department flow by 25-35%.
